label: QSAR Filter
description: Filter compounds based on QSAR data and physicochemical thresholds.

defaultInputs.name: Input Compounds
defaultInputs.tooltip: Compound table including SMILES and optional metadata from upstream nodes.

defaultOutputs.name: Filtered Results
defaultOutputs.tooltip: QSAR predictions and pass/fail flags for each compound.

configSchema.label: QSAR Models

options.label: QSPRpred - Flexible model building & benchmarking tasks

configSchema.tooltip:
Pick the QSAR engine:
- **ChemProp** – fast, general small‑molecule predictions.
- **OPERA** – curated, regulatory‑grade endpoints.
- **QSPRpred** – train custom models for benchmarking and internal data.

configSchema.label: Prediction Endpoint
configSchema.tooltip: For ChemProp, choose which property you want to predict for each compound.

configSchema.label: Confidence Threshold (%)
configSchema.tooltip: Minimum prediction confidence; lower values keep more compounds but with less certainty.

configSchema.label: Toxicity Analysis Notes
configSchema.placeholder: Enter specific toxicity parameters or notes...
configSchema.tooltip: Optional notes about toxicity scenarios, dose ranges, or study assumptions.

configSchema.label: OPERA Descriptor Set
configSchema.tooltip: Advanced: choose how rich the descriptor set should be for OPERA models.

configSchema.label: Training Mode
configSchema.tooltip: Controls QSPRpred training effort: **Quick** for prototyping, **Extensive** for best performance.

configSchema.label: Validation Split (%)
configSchema.tooltip: Share of data reserved for validation when training QSPRpred models.

configSchema.label: Enable Batch Processing
configSchema.tooltip: Advanced: toggle larger batch predictions for ChemProp/OPERA to speed up big libraries.

configSchema.label: Batch Size
configSchema.tooltip: Advanced: number of molecules processed per batch when batch processing is enabled.
